title: Cape Lookout National Seashore: Planning
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Planning             Planning      The National Park Service prepares a variety of planning and environmental documents to help guide it in managing park resources.  Theses documents can range from site-specific impact analyses on facility locations to broader park-wide plans for future use and management of a park.Current Documents & Plans -- here you will find general planning documents that cover the entire parkNew Plans -- Plans that are going through the comment phase or other pre-approval process will be found here.Wildlife Management -- annual reports and other information about nesting birds, turtles, the Shackleford Banks horses as well as endemic plant species.Historic Site Management -- Historic resource studies, historic structures reports, historic landscape reports and other information about the buildings and structures within the seashore's two historic districts.
